page.title: 13TANGMERE VILLAGE
page.content: The village was first mentioned in the Domesday Survey 1066 and is thought to be Saxon in origin. The name is saxon and means a pool at the junction of two ancient paths. The pool is no longer in existence having been filled in to become the village green. The village remained unchanged until the 20th century when it was chosen as a site for an aerodrome. With the 1st & 2nd World Wars, Tangmere was used as a RAF fighter base. Douglas Bader the legless flying ace was based at Tangmere and the only Village pub bears his name today. The RAF left Tangmere in 1967 and the airfield became deserted. Today the disused runways are bordered by wheat and the outer buildings are being demolished as the airfield has been sold t0 a private developer. The village is on the threshold of change.
